name: Ivan Lins
description:
'''Ivan Guimarães Lins''' (born 16 June 1945) is a [[Latin Grammy]]-winning Brazilian musician. He has been an active performer and songwriter of [[Música popular brasileira|Brazilian popular music (MPB)]] and [[jazz]] for over fifty years. His first hit, "Madalena", was recorded by [[Elis Regina]] in 1970. "Love Dance", a hit in 1989, is one of the most recorded songs in contemporary music .

His songs have been covered by [[Patti Austin]], [[David Benoit (musician)|David Benoit]], [[George Benson]], [[Michael Bublé]], [[Eliane Elias]], [[Ella Fitzgerald]], [[Dave Grusin]], [[Shirley Horn]], [[Quincy Jones]], [[Steve Kuhn]], [[the Manhattan Transfer]], [[Sérgio Mendes]], [[Jane Monheit]], [[Mark Murphy (singer)|Mark Murphy]], [[Carmen McRae]], [[Joe Pass]], [[Lee Ritenour]], [[Sarah Vaughan]], [[Diane Schuur]], [[Sting (musician)|Sting]], [[Barbra Streisand]], [[Take 6]], [[Toots Thielemans]], [[Dan Costa (musician)]] and [[Nancy Wilson (singer)|Nancy Wilson]].
